```{r Daten importieren, warning=FALSE}
# CSV-Datei einlesen
dfCensus <- read.csv('c.csv')[,-1] #Spalte 1 enthält nur Zeilennummer und wird entfernt
dfSurvey <- read.csv('s.csv')[,-1] #Spalte 1 enthält nur Zeilennummer und wird entfernt

# Nur gemeinsame erklärende Variablen werden behalten
dfCensus <- dfCensus[,colnames(dfCensus) %in% colnames(dfSurvey)]
dfSurvey <- data.frame("cuadrantes" = dfSurvey[,"cuadrantes"],
                       dfSurvey[,colnames(dfSurvey) %in% colnames(dfCensus)])
```

```{r Datenverständnis & -manipulation, warning = FALSE}
# Deskriptive Statistik
#str(dfSurvey)
#str(dfCensus)

# Anteil an fehlenden Werten bestimmen und in einer Tabelle zusammenfassen
missingSurvey <- data.frame("Variable" = colnames(dfSurvey), "MissingSurvey" = t(data.frame(lapply(dfSurvey, function(x) round(100*sum(is.na(x))/length(x),1)))), row.names = NULL)
missingCensus <- data.frame("Variable" = colnames(dfCensus), "MissingCensus" = t(data.frame(lapply(dfCensus, function(x) round(100*sum(is.na(x))/length(x),1)))), row.names = NULL)
missingDF <- left_join(missingSurvey, missingCensus, by = 'Variable')
missingAll <- left_join(missingSurvey, missingCensus, by = 'Variable')
missingDF <- missingDF[which(missingDF[,2] > 10 & missingDF[,3] > 10),]
row.names(missingDF) <- c(1:nrow(missingDF))

rm(missingSurvey)
rm(missingCensus)

# Latex-Tabelle-Formatierung 
#xtable(missingDF) 

# Variablen mit zu vielen fehlenden Werten werden entfernt
dfCensus <- dfCensus[, !(colnames(dfCensus) %in% missingDF[1:5,1])]
dfSurvey <- dfSurvey[, !(colnames(dfSurvey) %in% missingDF[1:5,1])]

# Variable ent wird entfernt, da nur ein Wert für alle Beobachtungen
dfCensus <- dfCensus[, -which(colnames(dfCensus) %in% c('ent'))]
dfSurvey <- dfSurvey[, -which(colnames(dfSurvey) %in% c('ent'))]

# Hilfsvariablen werden entfernt
hilfsvariablen <- c('est_dis', 'factor', 'mun', 'upm')
dfSurvey <- dfSurvey[ , !(names(dfSurvey)  %in% hilfsvariablen)]
dfCensus <- dfCensus[ , !(names(dfCensus)  %in% hilfsvariablen)]
rm(hilfsvariablen)

# Transformation numerischer in nomialer Variablen. Ausgenommen sind edad und anos_escolaridad, da sie metrisch skaliert sind.
dfSurvey$cuadrantes <- factor(dfSurvey$cuadrantes, levels = c(1,2,3,4,5), 
                                 labels = c('extrem','gemildert',
                                            'anfällig aufgrund Einkommen', 
                                            'anfällig aufgrund Sozialmangel', 'keine'))

dfSurvey$asis_esc <- dfSurvey$asis_esc - 1 #Damit gleiche Werte mit Census Datei
dfCensus$sexo <- dfCensus$sexo - 1 #Damit gleiche Werte mit Survey Datei

names(dfSurvey)[7] <- 'anos_escolaridad' #Umbenennung für richtige Zeichencodierung
names(dfCensus)[6] <- 'anos_escolaridad' #Umbenennung für richtige Zeichencodierung

listDF <- c("dfSurvey", "dfCensus")

for (i in c(1,2)) {
    
    df <- list(dfSurvey, dfCensus)[[i]]
    
    df$parentesco <- factor(df$parentesco)
    df$sexo <- factor(df$sexo, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Weiblich','Männlich'))
    df$habl_ind <- factor(df$habl_ind, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$asis_esc <- factor(df$asis_esc, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$pea <- factor(df$pea)
    df$c_ocupa <- factor(df$c_ocupa)
    df$sector_act <- factor(df$sector_act)
    df$jub <- factor(df$jub, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$dhind_cy <- factor(df$dhind_cy, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$dhind_parent <- factor(df$dhind_parent, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$ic_rezedu <- factor(df$ic_rezedu, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$ic_asalud <- factor(df$ic_asalud, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$ic_cv <- factor(df$ic_cv, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$ic_sbv <- factor(df$ic_sbv, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Nein','Ja'))
    df$rururb <- factor(df$rururb, levels = c(0,1), labels = c('Städtisch','Ländlich'))
    df$tam_loc <- factor(df$tam_loc, levels = c(1,2,3,4), labels = c('mehr als 100.000','15.000 bis 99.999', '2.500 bis 14.999', 'weniger als 2.500'))
    df$idD <- factor(df$idD)
    
    assign(listDF[i], df , envir = .GlobalEnv)
}

rm(df)
rm(listDF)
rm(i)
```

```{r Behandlung fehlender Werte, warning = FALSE}
# Fehlende Werte asis_esc & habl_ind 
## (dfSurvey: Modus je Armutskategorie; dfCensus: Modus)
Mode2 <- function(x) {tab <- table(x); names(tab)[which.max(tab)]} #Quelle: https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-help/2010-March/231975.html 
aggregate(dfSurvey[c('asis_esc', 'habl_ind')],
          by = list(dfSurvey$cuadrantes),
          FUN = Mode2)
rm(Mode2)

dfSurvey$asis_esc[which(is.na(dfSurvey$asis_esc))] <- 'Ja'
dfSurvey$habl_ind[which(is.na(dfSurvey$habl_ind))] <- 'Nein'

dfCensus$asis_esc[which(is.na(dfSurvey$asis_esc))] <- names(which.max(table(dfCensus['asis_esc'])))
dfCensus$habl_ind[which(is.na(dfSurvey$habl_ind))] <- names(which.max(table(dfCensus['habl_ind'])))

# Fehlende Werte anos_escolaridad 
# (dfSurvey: Median je Armutskategorie; dfCensus: Median)
anosCuad <- aggregate(dfSurvey['anos_escolaridad'],
          by = list(dfSurvey$cuadrantes),
          FUN = median,
          na.rm = TRUE,
          na.action = na.pass)
for (i in c('extrem','gemildert','anfällig aufgrund Einkommen', 'anfällig aufgrund Sozialmangel', 'keine')) {
    
    dfSurvey$anos_escolaridad[which(is.na(dfSurvey$anos_escolaridad) &
                           dfSurvey$cuadrantes == i)] <- anosCuad[which(anosCuad == i),2]
    
}

rm(i)
rm(anosCuad)

dfCensus$anos_escolaridad[which(is.na(dfSurvey$anos_escolaridad))] <- median(dfCensus$anos_escolaridad, na.rm = TRUE)

# Restliche NAs werden aus dfCensus entfernt
dfCensus <- na.omit(dfCensus)

# Kontrollieren, ob alle fehlenden Werte schon bereinigt wurden
all(!is.na(dfSurvey))
all(!is.na(dfCensus))
```

```{r Vorbereitung für Modellierung}

# Datensatz in Trainings- und Testdatendatz splitten
library(caTools)
set.seed(123)
split = sample.split(dfSurvey$cuadrantes, SplitRatio = 0.75)
trainingSurvey = subset(dfSurvey, split == TRUE)
validSurvey = subset(dfSurvey, split == FALSE)
rm(split)

# Vorbereitung k-fache Kreuzvalidierung
library(caret)
set.seed(123)
folds <- createFolds(dfSurvey$cuadrantes, k = 10, list = TRUE, returnTrain = FALSE)

```


```{r Modellierung Multimomiale logistische Regression}
# MLR modellieren (anhand Trainingsdatensatz)
library(nnet)

# MLR Modellierung
MLR_FULL <- multinom(cuadrantes ~ ., data = trainingSurvey)

# Rückwärtsselektion nach AIC
MLR_AIC <- step(MLR_FULL, direction = 'backward', trace = 0)
    
# Nach AIC zu entfernende Variablen
MLR_rmVar <- paste(MLR_FULL$vcoefnames[which(!(MLR_FULL$vcoefnames %in% MLR_AIC$vcoefnames))], collapse = " ")

# MLR Vorhersage
MLR_yPred <- predict(MLR_AIC, newdata = validSurvey[-1])

# MLR Confusion Matrix
MLR_confMat = table(true = validSurvey[,1], pred = MLR_yPred)

# MLR Genauigkeit
MLR_Accuracy <- sum(diag(MLR_confMat))/sum(MLR_confMat)



# MLR k-fache Kreuzvalidierung
MLR_Accuracy <- data.frame(Fold = integer(), Accuracy = integer())
MLR_rmVar <- data.frame(Fold = integer(), rmVar = integer())
MLR_confMat <- list()

for (i in c(1:10)) {
    
    validID <- i
    trainID <- c(1:10)[which(!(c(1:10) == i))]
    
    validSurvey <- dfSurvey[folds[[validID]],]
    trainingSurvey <- dfSurvey[c(unlist(folds[trainID])),]
    
    MLR_FULL <- multinom(cuadrantes ~ ., data = trainingSurvey)
    MLR_AIC <- step(MLR_FULL, direction = 'backward', trace = 0)
    
    MLR_rmVar[i,] <- c(i, paste(MLR_FULL$vcoefnames[which(!(MLR_FULL$vcoefnames %in% MLR_AIC$vcoefnames))], collapse = " "))
    
    # MLR k-fache Kreuzvalidierung Vorhersage
    MLR_yPred <- predict(MLR_AIC, newdata = validSurvey[-1])
    
    # MLR k-fache Kreuzvalidierung Confusion Matrix
    MLR_confMat[[i]] = table(true = validSurvey[,1], pred = MLR_yPred)
    
    # MLR k-fache Kreuzvalidierung Genauigkeit
    MLR_Accuracy[i,] <- c(i, sum(diag(MLR_confMat[[i]]))/sum(MLR_confMat[[i]])) 
    
}

mean(MLR_Accuracy$Accuracy)

rm(i)
```

```{r Simulation Szenario 1}
# SVM Parameteroptimierung anhand einem Paar Sample - Population
dfTrain <- popList[[1]]$smp
dfValid <- popList[[1]]$pop

tune <- tune.svm(y ~ X_1 + X_2, data = dfTrain,
             gamma = 10^(c(-3:3)),
             cost = 10^(c(-3:3)))

# MLR und SVM für jedes Paar Sample - Population
MLR_Accuracy <- data.frame(Fold = integer(), Accuracy = integer())
SVM_Accuracy <- data.frame(Fold = integer(), Accuracy = integer())

for (i in c(1:simRuns)) {
    dfTrain <- popList[[i]]$smp # Sample als Trainingsdaten
    dfValid <- popList[[i]]$pop # Population als Validierungsdaten
    
    # MLR
    MLR_FULL <- multinom(y ~ X_1 + X_2, data = dfTrain)
    MLR_AIC <- step(MLR_FULL, direction = 'backward', trace = 0)
        
    # MLR Vorhersage
    MLR_yPred <- predict(MLR_AIC, newdata = dfValid[-1])
    
    # MLR Confusion Matrix
    MLR_confMat = table(true = dfValid[,1], pred = MLR_yPred)
    
    # MLR Genauigkeit
    MLR_Accuracy[i,] <- c(i, sum(diag(MLR_confMat))/sum(MLR_confMat))
    
    # SVM
    classifierSVM <- svm(y ~ .,
                  data = dfTrain,
                  type = "C-classification",
                  kernel = "radial"
                  , gamma = 0.1, 
                  cost = 10)
    
    # SVM Vorhersage
    y_pred_SVM = predict(classifierSVM, newdata = dfValid[-1])
    
    # SVM Confusion Matrix
    confMat_SVM = table(true = dfValid[,1], pred = y_pred_SVM)
    
    # SVM Genauigkeit
    SVM_Accuracy[i,] <- c(i,sum(diag(confMat_SVM))/sum(confMat_SVM))
   
}

boxplot(MLR_Accuracy$Accuracy, SVM_Accuracy$Accuracy)
```
